1.title: the beginning

12.content:
I passed judgment on another of my ex subjects not unlike the others he had once been one of my followers back when the country was in turmoil just after the old king had died. But now he was one of the many leaders in this new uprising. They claimed they were fighting for the freedom of their nation and another Dictator ship was not what they were looking for. I bent down to look him in the eye.
"Do I look like another dictator to you?" my crown falling off slightly.
"Yes" he said "as long as you wear that crown you are just another dictator preying off the weak who once supported your coming to power. You promised that you would bring freedom to those under your rule you bastard." And then he spat in my face.
"Guards" I said. "take him to the dungeons... but put him apart from the others in cell #1337."
As the guards were leaving and helping the rebel to his feet I could hear them whisper "be grateful the king's in a better mood than normal. Your friends might not be so lucky though now." I had the satisfaction of seeing him droop his head in sadness knowing that he could have just provoked the death of one of his friends.
Bring in the next one I said and in came a girl maybe 13...
12.title: viva la vida

choices: ... steer the truck away from the wreckage
155332222222222212222221.content:
You spent another night of no sleep, back on the road again in your truck. HQ hasn't contacted you back if the shipment is canceled but since you need to get paid, you're continuing to your destination as if there wasn't a problem. The radio crackles with another news flash of an attack in a major city. The initial blast killed dozens but the announcer says in a grim tone that some of the survivors have been acting erratically, attacking the first responders and swarming the ambulances. Those poor people, you shake your head. You know some of the other rig drivers who came back from the war with PTSD, this seems to be an extreme version of that. You click the radio off and focus again on the road.

Insomnia is wrecking your life. You could barely look at the road without your eyelids feeling extremely heavy and your thoughts beginning to fade off with every blink. With one eye still on the road, you look in the glove compartment for the bottle of No-Doz. God, this stuff must be wrecking my liver, you think as you pop the capsules open. You are fumbling around with one hand and holding the steering wheel when you see something up on the road ahead. At first it looks like some people gathered around roadkill but as the truck gets closer, you see there is the burning wreckage of a sedan and groups of people crowded by the side of the road. Shit! You hold onto the steering wheel and drop the caffeine pills all over the driver's seat. You make a quick move to...
155332222222222212222221.title: Brain Stew

choices: You pop a few more caffeine pills
Decide you have to set the truck on fire...
1553322222222222122222211.content:
You decide at that moment to do whatever it takes to not plow the rig straight through the scene of a previous accident and some of the curious bystanders. This proves to be a much more dangerous move because of the weight of the truck and all of the cargo. Anticipating that at worst, you end up dying, you grab onto the steering wheel and turn it all the way so that the heavy vehicle creaks weakly and all of the weight begins to shift towards the side. Surprisingly you do not see the people even flinch as the truck flips upside down, sliding on the road at them like a deadly projectile. Some of them don't even lift their up or watch. You don't have much time to think about it because suddenly you are hanging upside down, gasping for air and feeling just a little bruised from what looked like a pretty bad accident.

You dangle from the roof o the truck spinning around, feeling like your head has been split in two. Meanwhile the witnesses outside haven't even come to see if you were okay or reacted at all. What is wrong with people these days? You unclasp the seat belt and feebly try to leave the wrecked truck. Your company is going to charge you for this and fire you, what a day...
Before you exit the vehicle, you look into the glove compartment. You take your company issued pistol and pocket it just in case.
1553322222222222122222211.title: Stuck with Me

choices: Cut through the crowd and see what the big deal is
Fire a round into the sky
15533222222222221222222111.content:
By a few more, you actually mean the remainder of the container. Trying to recover from being in an accident has your brain rattled and you are disoriented but feeling the pep of the caffeine pills. You yell out to the people in the middle of the road, calling out if anyone is injured. They do not even bother to turn their heads to look at you. They continue to face off onto the other side of the road with their backs turned. You can't believe how rude these people are, you almost died trying to not crash into one of them! You keep shouting and starting to throw some curse words in there. Didn't they notice that there was an accident just right there? They better be staring at Bigfoot's corpse or something extraordinary to not even... Then you realize something is wrong with these people. You are catching up to them and with their bodies still looking away, you notice how limp their arms look, and how leathery and sick their skin appears. You reach down to hold the spot where your gun is holstered. Are they on some sort of drug, maybe? You really don't want to have to use your gun but if they start attacking you in their crazed, violent high... what choice do you have? Now that they are so close, you can see that the group is actually ten or so members, a mix of males and females. You can't tell their ages since their faces are looking away but they seem to be young adults to middle-aged.

The buzz from almost dying and the caffeine is making you feel extra impulsive and you realize your next move.
Now you have to...
15533222222222221222222111.title: Panic Song

155332222222222212222221112.content:
You shoot up right into the sky just to see if it has any reaction on the crowd. When the bullet flies up and its pop crackles throughout the sky, you immediately regret what you've done. This has much more of an effect on the crowd than your yelling and cursing at them. Their heads slowly swivel around like they have no bones in them and you freak out because there is something seriously wrong with these people. Beyond drugs... The faces of the multiple men and women are focusing directly at you by the wreckage of your truck. A few of them watch the smoke puffing out from the crash site with a sort of amusement.

"Alright, let's not do anything we're going to regret..." You say much more calmly to the crowd of ill-looking people with hanging limbs and sinister blank expressions. There don't seem to be a lot of choices here. Your gun has limited ammunition so it's not like you can blast your way out of this one. But maybe if you mow down a few, the rest of them will fall back in fear? If they can even feel such a thing in their state. You can also run back down towards the woods surrounding the road. It is getting pretty dark so it might not be the safest place to be but it is better than dealing with this mob. You hold your gun tightly and walk back the mound. Their eyes follow you and you can see them begin to follow you. They shuffle around, as if walking around is a huge ordeal. The looks on their faces do not blink and look craving, as if they are more bestial than human. At least they can't move too quickly, you think to yourself. Maybe it is time to put that good aim to use, you don't have forever to think about your choice...
155332222222222212222221112.title: Tight Wad Hill

choices: Reliving the glory of an old quarterback's best days...
1553322222222222122222211121.content:
Maybe it is the drugs. Maybe it is the fear of being torn apart by a crowd of drugged up psychopaths. You aim the handgun at the crowd and begin to fire indiscreetly at the closest people trudging along in your direction. You're horrified briefly at what you've done as the bullets leave the chamber. But this horror at yourself and what you've descended to as a person disappears when you see the bullets tear through the mob without any effect. You fired three rounds but instead of three corpses, the people you shot continue walking towards you with no expression and the gunfire having just ripped through their clothes and flesh. What the hell? It can't be... that only happens in movies. You try to convince yourself this isn't happening. After having seen so many movies it was kind of dumb for you to not even have a gameplan for this! "Look, I don't want to just throw the 'z word' out like this..." Your eyes feel like they're going to pop out of your head. You're not going to be useful once the stim buzz wears off so you might as well do whatever you can to survive. You take a breath and get ready to show off something you haven't done since high school.

Until an ankle ruined your chances of going to State, you were the 6'4'' terror of a quarterback to any rival team. You have been driving trucks for awhile but managed to still keep in shape. This would work out as long as no one took a chomp out of you, right? You bend to stiffen your knee. Then you grunt and charge into the crowd like a cannonball.
1553322222222222122222211121.title: Westbound Sign

15533222222222222.content: "Something Wicked Comes this Way by Barry Adamson
15533222222222222.title: Something else

info.brief_description: write a story out of a song
info.description:
this is a collection of stories based off songs. I ask only 4 things of you
1. check spelling
2. credit songs creator(s) I don't want any legal trouble with anyone
3. have fun and be creative
4. leave an option open for the story to continue in the beginning
aprt from these thing use any song you want
